result.execSummary:
The defendant Tremell Lc Hinton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
All costs, assessments and surcharges ordered in 15CM2180 and 15CM2201 are to be paid during period of probation. Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Restitution is set at 0.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
Parenting classes.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tremell Lc Hinton

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tremell Lc Hinton in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
No reply from defendant or surety.

Defendant Tremell Lc Hinton in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Tremell Lc Hinton in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
AS TO COUNTS 2 and 3:  Upon motion of state, court orders counts dismissed and read in.
Sentencing proceeded as to count 1.  Statements by parties.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 120 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11-13-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Parenting classes.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  All costs, assessments and surcharges ordered in 15CM2180 and 15CM2201 are to be paid during period of probation.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at 0.
Appeal rights given
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Court ordered case rescheduled to 8/17/2015 at 8:15 am.
Court ordered case rescheduled for 8/14/2015 at 8:15 am.

Court modifies bail as to all three cases.
